item.title: a smol zine about clojure
item.description: Summer 2018 was a dream. me & saskia were writing open source under the auspices of rgsoc & the clojure community, which gave me a home in berlin <3 (zine format is not simple to print or read. to recieve a copy, you can email/message me and I’ll send you a physically assembled one.) Here’s a preview of the cover:

item.title: a tiny life in the east side
item.description: A zine-shape assembled from the comics I drew on a small climbing/work trip to the east side with marco \o/ (zine format is not simple to print or read. to recieve a copy, you can email/message me and I’ll send you a physically assembled one.) Here’s a preview of the cover:

item.title: daiyi's family: micro-zine
item.description: This is a staple-less micro-zine that I folded out of single sheet of paper. There is not a digital copy available (: I’m happy to show it to you in person.

item.description: I illustrated an ebook about implementing observability. You can download it here (: # TODO

item.title: Thousand Island Lakes, a backpacking trip in watercolour journals
item.description: We went for a stroll in the High Sierra. We woke up covered in frost.

item.title: Vanna Cafe
item.description: A branding project for the crag-side pop-up cafe that marco’s van sometimes transforms into if the moment arises \o/

item.title: distractibility cartographers
item.description: a zine collective of daiyi & rfong. We are a smol group of smol humans chronically distracted by the great open secret that there are worlds of unending fascination tucked into every facet of the mundane. Grab onto our coattails as we organize concepts beyond the point of ludicrosity, precariously tumble down arbitrarily deep rabbitholes of obscure fun facts about things you didnâ€™t know you wanted to know about, and dispense relatable hot tips.

item.title: Thailand: watercolour travel journals
item.description: I spent a couple weeks in Thailand in 2015. I encountered many bugs, many of them are captured below.

item.title: light-up mural
item.description: For our college hovse’s first annual hackathon, my roommate kerry & I made a light-up mural.
